description:
First, I love cryptomator. I find it to be a vera-good alternative to it's largest competitor, with a better UI and more flexibility. I find it is a perfect solution for encrypting volumes which do not have a large NUMBER of files.

I have found when there is a lot of files (I'm talking more than 10-20k at least), due to the fact that Cryptomator encrypts/decrypts in real time as files are accessed, if you are ever transferring a large amount of files into an encrypted volume, or trying to transfer them out from an unencrypted volume (or god forbid, out of and then into a different Cryptomator volume), your read + write speeds will be slower than a lobotomized snail stuck in molasses. Even transferring volumes that have small size (~10-30GB) will take AGES if there is a large amount of individual files. 

From one 7200rpm HDD to another, it was significantly faster for me to transfer a singular 600gb iso file out from an encrypted volume than it was a 72GB encrypted volume consisting of ~108k individual files (mostly images), and when I say significant I mean the 600gb iso took about ~20 minutes and the 72GB volume took ~4 hours.

My advice so those who wish to encrypt volumes which have a large number of individual files is to use a method where the volume is encrypted/decrypted completely in one go - at boot or on demand - like a LUKS encrypted partition.
summary: Excellent for small volumes, loses luster in volumes with >10k files

description: I cant lock the encrypted folder , always keep showing that some process is using the folder but nothing uses it
Does what it needs to do. The system tray is a bit weird on gnome but it is functional.
I cant understand why does it need network access

Tried this in the steam deck desktop version. Technically, it works but not the usual way:
1) the external sd card folder does not show up in the directory list when you choose a customer location to create the container (/run/media/mmcblk0p1) so you can only save the container on the internal drive (could become a problem on the 64 GB steam deck).

2) revealing the drive does nothing. Nothing pops up and you see no drive or directory in the file browser either. You have to manually go to the shown folder path in via your preferred files browser to access the files. So yeah, it works that way but not very user friendly and not for beginners either probably.
summary: Not fully compatible with steam deck

description: works great and recommended
it didn't work but now it does
summary: it didn't work but now it does

description: Does not use wayland, but XWayland(X Server), which causes bugs. For example black-filled modal windows and other problems.
get stuff done
The few apps supported on Linux are always frustrating to guess if they'll even work ;/
summary: Trash, throws error when trying to unlock

description: Tolles Programm um seine Daten in der Cloud verschlüsselt zu speichern.

Verschlüsselt zuverlässig meine Dateien in der Cloud und auf USB-Sticks, sodass ich von Linux, Windows oder Android darauf zugreifen kann. Getestet auf Fedora 36 funktioniert bei mir auch die Verschlüsselung von FUSE-Laufwerken, was in eineren früheren Rezension bemägelt wurde.
summary: Sehr empfehlenswertes Programm zur Verschlüsselung von Clouds

description: Entgegen anderer Meinung funktioniert der Fuse Zugriff unter fedora 36 weiterhin nicht.  App Version 1.6.15 als AppImage. Der Rest Funktioniert soweit.

I have been using this for over 2 years now, not just on my Linux Laptop but also on my iPad, iPhone and Windows PC. 

It is actively maintained and steadily improved upon. Great recommendation who want to encrypt their files in a container first before uploading data e.g. to the cloud.
The Flatpak is currently entirely unrestricted, and it is not fully clear where it needs access to. This is a requirement to run it sandboxed.
summary: Very useful but needs Flatpak adaption

description: Nutze es nun schon seit etwas über 2 Jahren. Funktioniert sehr gut. Ich nutze verschiedene Betriessysteme: Win11, Linux (Ubuntu, auf verschiedenen Rechnern mit unterschiedlichen Ubuntu Versionen), ipad, Android Smartphone. Überall sehr gut umgesetzt. Und in Kombination mit pcloud habe ich immer und überall meine Daten verschlüsselt verfügbar.
simple d'utilisation, multiplatforme. Fonctionne parfaitement.

Pas eu de problèmes en 3 mois d'utilisation
debian 12, kernel 6.1.0, gnome 43.9

J'ai testé la version flatpak, elle n'a pas accès à un périphérique USB, c'est bien génant. 
Je vais désinstaller, et essayer en appimage
Можно создавать отдельные папки. Правда, в облаке еще не пользовался.
